date: Sun Mar 20 2022 00:29:19 GMT+1100 (Australian Eastern Daylight Time)
description: Holi is named after Holika, the demoness aunt of a king's disloyal son in a myth. Effigies of Holika burnt throughout the holiday reference this myth. The ritual of throwing colored powder, traditionally known as gulal, and water is rooted in the legend of Radha and Krishna. In that tale, a young Krishna, the Hindu god of protection, compassion, tenderness and love, doused Radha with colors on her face out of jealousy.
metaDescription: Holi is named after Holika, the demoness aunt of a king's disloyal son in a myth when a young Krishna, the Hindu god of love, doused Radha with colors on her face out of jealousy.
generatedText: Holi, who was born in the city of Krasnoyarsk, was a member of the Krasnoyarsk People's
